Description: Lower body sherd of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black (fired reddish); faded added colour: red band between two added white bands; part of lotus flower in white outline; exterior: three brown bands above two more at bottom of sherd; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: The sherd joins British Museum1924,1201.466.a and probably belongs to the same vessel as British Museum 1924,1201.466.c and 1924,1201.517 (the obverse of the vessel has a guilloche pattern instead of a maeander pattern).
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0475) (phase 2)
